What You'll Do:

Criteo uses massive commerce datasets to help advertisers and media owners reach their goals. As a Data Analyst on the LATAM Analytics team, you will work with Criteo's clients to understand how they measure the value of their marketing efforts. You will analyze shopping behavior on client websites, apps, and physical stores. By combining this with Criteo's marketing data, you will have the opportunity to create compelling data-driven recommendations to help our biggest advertisers maximize the value they see from their Criteo investment.

Make smart and careful use of SQL to query massive Hive and Vertica databases (we don't use the term massive lightly: our clusters store close to 171 PB of data, with tens of TB of new data stored daily)

Frequently interact with commercial teams to share data-driven recommendations and insights for their clients
Maintain deep knowledge of Criteo products and technologies as they evolve

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. A US-based member-only company that supplies superior quality natural and organic food products is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be taking ownership of the company's merchandising analysis and providing in-depth insights on how to improve the user experience and member engagement. The company is bringing the benefits of healthy and fresh eating to the customer‚Äôs doorsteps with the click of a few buttons. They have managed to successfully raise $200mn+ in funding so far. This role requires 6-8+ hours of overlap with the PST time zone.




Job Responsibilities:




Assist Product Management, Data Science, Marketing, and Technology teams to gather, manipulate, evaluate, and documenting new, complex data and sharing cohesive data stories
Drive member acquisition growth through sponsored social marketing platforms
Use the scientific method to create A/B tests and MVA experiments, encompassing ad creatives, targeting tactics, and onsite experiences, among other things
Monitor key performance indicators, offer data-driven recommendations, and lobby for the internal resources needed to keep member growth going
Deliver ideas and insights based on both competitive and online analytics
Define critical success criteria and establish data-driven and prioritized roadmaps to produce solutions to break down unclear situations
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in business development, product development, design, and engineering to develop and implement the most innovative growth ideas
Gather, manipulate, analyze, and document raw, complicated data, and then present coherent data stories to business and technical audiences
Develop a thorough grasp of user activity patterns and insights, as well as the relationship between engagement measures and conversion rates, customer lifetime value, and financial success
Create dashboards, visualizations, and detailed datasets to give meaningful merchandising, category activity, and profit potential insights.

At least 4+ years of relevant experience as a marketing data analyst
Demonstrable experience working with SQL, Python/R, Tableau, Looker, and Domo
Nice to have some experience with Google Analytics, Amplitude, or Mixpanel
Prior experience with A/B testing, cohort analysis, conversion optimization, and customer segmentation is desirable
Good leadership abilities, a positive attitude, and an active / self-starter mindset Enthusiasm for turning data into insights and helping others uncover the power of their data
Help develop a healthy team environment by being a team player with character, humility, and honesty
Ability to communicate data stories to business and technical audiences in a clear and concise manner
Proficiency and solid foundation in statistics

Job_description:
opportunity code 19247




Hello, Data Analyst come to one of the leading digital transformation companies in the country!




INTERNATIONAL PROJECT




About BRQ Digital

In the market for 30 years, BRQ Digital Solutions has established itself as one of the largest digital transformation companies in the country. With an end-to-end service platform, we offer the most efficient and innovative solutions, technologies and methodologies, promoting a journey of transformation for major brands, from different segments, in Brazil and abroad. Our 3,000 employees work under the Anywhere Office work model and the company is featured as one of the best places to work by GPTW and Glassdoor.




What are we looking for?

We are looking for a #fera with an entrepreneurial spirit who knows he is the true protagonist of his own success! We want in our team people motivated by challenges, constant evolution and, of course, who are passionate about technology and transformation!




You must have:

Excellent experience with EQT - Bloomberg market data;
Advanced to fluent english;




What do we have to offer you?

More than a career plan!




BRQ believes that each #Fera should be the protagonist of their own growth, having the autonomy to create their own professional development plan. Our career plan is divided into 4 stages:

- Technical career: You can follow the technical growth path, if your goal is to develop more and more in different technologies. We offer various trainings!

- Lidership Career: Do you want a new professional direction? Here at home we have several different options and the internal mobility program, which allows you to change areas, for example.

- International experience: We are growing more and more outside Brazil and you have the possibility of working in projects for other countries, or directly in the countries where BRQ is headquartered.

- Entrepreneurship: From employee to partner! We have the Innovation Hub, the Corporate Venture that invests in ideas from professionals who have synergy with our business.




And the benefits?

Health plan; Dental Plan; Life insurance; Meal ticket; Food Voucher; Flexible schedule; Gympass, Telemedicine, Telenutrition, 24h emotional support channel and much more!

What is it like to work at BRQ?

We have a relaxed atmosphere, several programs and internal events. We love to celebrate! And we do it very well! See it here on Youtube: youtube.com/brqdigitalsolutions

Sign up and come to the best of Digital Transformation with us! üöÄ

Job_description:
A US-based member-only company that supplies superior quality natural and organic food products is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be taking ownership of the company's merchandising analysis and providing in-depth insights on how to improve the user experience and member engagement. The company is bringing the benefits of healthy and fresh eating to the customer‚Äôs doorsteps with the click of a few buttons. They have managed to successfully raise $200mn+ in funding so far. This role requires 6-8+ hours of overlap with the PST time zone.




Job Responsibilities:




Assist Product Management, Data Science, Marketing, and Technology teams to gather, manipulate, evaluate, and documenting new, complex data and sharing cohesive data stories
Drive member acquisition growth through sponsored social marketing platforms
Use the scientific method to create A/B tests and MVA experiments, encompassing ad creatives, targeting tactics, and onsite experiences, among other things
Monitor key performance indicators, offer data-driven recommendations, and lobby for the internal resources needed to keep member growth going
Deliver ideas and insights based on both competitive and online analytics
Define critical success criteria and establish data-driven and prioritized roadmaps to produce solutions to break down unclear situations
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in business development, product development, design, and engineering to develop and implement the most innovative growth ideas
Gather, manipulate, analyze, and document raw, complicated data, and then present coherent data stories to business and technical audiences
Develop a thorough grasp of user activity patterns and insights, as well as the relationship between engagement measures and conversion rates, customer lifetime value, and financial success
Create dashboards, visualizations, and detailed datasets to give meaningful merchandising, category activity, and profit potential insights.
Serve as a tactical liaison with Product Management teams to give the most accurate and timely information possible that'll help drive business decisions




Job Requirements:




Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4+ years of relevant experience as a marketing data analyst
Demonstrable experience working with SQL, Python/R, Tableau, Looker, and Domo
Nice to have some experience with Google Analytics, Amplitude, or Mixpanel
Prior experience with A/B testing, cohort analysis, conversion optimization, and customer segmentation is desirable
Good leadership abilities, a positive attitude, and an active / self-starter mindset Enthusiasm for turning data into insights and helping others uncover the power of their data
Help develop a healthy team environment by being a team player with character, humility, and honesty
Ability to communicate data stories to business and technical audiences in a clear and concise manner
Proficiency and solid foundation in statistics

Job_description:
About Fusemachines




Fusemachines is a leading AI strategy, talent, and education services provider. Founded by Sameer Maskey Ph.D., Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, Fusemachines has a core mission of democratizing AI. With a presence in 4 countries (Nepal, United States, Canada, and Dominican Republic and more than 350 full-time employees) Fusemachines seeks to bring its global expertise in AI to transform companies around the world.




About the role:




This is a remote, full time consulting position (contract) responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure required for data integration, storage, processing, and analytics (BI, visualization and Advanced Analytics).




Qualification / Skill Set Requirement:




5+ years of real-world data engineering development experience in AWS (certifications preferred)
Strong programming Skills in one or more languages such as Python, Scala, and proficient in writing efficient and optimized code for data integration, storage, processing and manipulation.
Strong knowledge SDLC tools and technologies, including project management software (Jira or similar), source code management (GitHub or similar), CI/CD system (GitHub actions, AWS CodeBuild or similar) and binary repository manager (AWS CodeArtifact or similar).
Good understanding of Data Modeling and Database Design Principles. Being able to design and implement efficient database schemas that meet the requirements of the data architecture to support data solutions.
Skilled in Data Integration from different sources such as APIs, databases, flat files, event streaming.
Strong experience in working with ELT and ETL tools and being able to develop custom integration solutions as needed.
Strong experience with scalable and distributed Data Technologies such as Spark/PySpark, DBT and Kafka, to be able to handle large volumes of data.
Strong experience in designing and implementing Data Warehousing solutions. Demonstrated experience in designing and implementing efficient ELT/ETL processes that extract data from source systems, transform it, and load it into the data warehouse.
Expert in Cloud Computing in AWS, including deep knowledge of a variety of AWS services like Lambda, Kinesis, S3, Lake Formation, EC2, ECS/ECR, IAM, CloudWatch, Redshift, etc
Good understanding of Data Quality and Governance, including implementation of data quality checks and monitoring processes to ensure that data is accurate, complete, and consistent.
Good Problem-Solving skills: being able to troubleshoot data processing pipelines and identify performance bottlenecks and other issues.
Strong Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres, MongoDB, ElasticSearch
Possesses strong leadership skills with a willingness to lead, create Ideas, and be assertive




Responsibilities:




Design and develop high-performance, large-scale, complex data architectures, which support data integration (batch and real-time), storage (data lakes, warehouses, marts, etc), processing and infrastructure.
Ensuring the scalability, reliability, and performance of data systems.
Mentoring and guiding junior/mid-level data engineers.
Collaborating with Product, Engineering, Data Scientists and Analysts to understand data requirements and develop data solutions, including reusable components.
Evaluating and implementing new technologies and tools to improve data integration, data processing and analysis.
Care about architecture, observability, testing, and building reliable infrastructure and data pipelines.
Conduct Discovery on existing Data Infrastructure and Proposed Architecture.
Evaluate, design, and implement data governance solutions: cataloging, lineage, quality and data governance frameworks that are suitable for a modern analytics solution, considering industry-standard best practices and patterns.
Assess best practices and design schemas that matches business needs for delivering a modern analytics solution (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive)
Be an active member of our Agile team, participating in all ceremonies and continuous improvement activities.

Job_description:
Our mission is to unlock the collaborative power of communities by making Web3 universally easy to use, access, and build on




Working with ConsenSys puts you at the forefront of an evolving paradigm, transforming our society for the better. We fundamentally believe blockchain is the next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society.




Blockchain tech is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler and we‚Äôre far from reaching our full potential. You‚Äôll get to work on the tools, infrastructure, and apps that scale these platforms to billions of users.




You‚Äôll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers, and as you work on different projects ‚Äî challenging you to stay at the top of your game. You‚Äôll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies.




About Customer Success




The Customer Success team at ConsenSys is focused on exactly that: making our customers successful. We‚Äôre looking for people who will step towards a customer who is asking for help and respond with innovative and creative ideas to help them course-correct. If you value constructive customer engagement and want to define the future of Blockchain production operations, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




What You‚Äôll Do




We are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join our Customer Success Business Operations Team. You will collaborate with our company‚Äôs Data Engineering Team to implement a comprehensive data management program. Your role will involve consolidating data generated across Customer Success and presenting it to decision makers company-wide. As the sole data engineer responsible for Customer Success data, you will be responsible for building, maintaining, and evolving our data program while aligning with our firm wide data strategy.




Key responsibilities:




Design, implement, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines and workflows to support the collection, storage, and processing of large volumes of data from various sources within Customer Success.
Collaborate with our company‚Äôs Data Engineering Teams in addition to other Customer Success teams, to define data requirements, identify sources, and ensure quality and integrity.
Develop and maintain data infrastructure and systems, including data warehouses, data lakes, ETL processes, and data modeling frameworks.
Perform data cleaning, transformation, and enrichment to prepare raw data for analysis and reporting.
Optimize data processing and storage for performance and scalability, implementing best practices for data management and data security.
Identify and resolve data-related issues, troubleshoot system failures, and provide timely support to internal stakeholders.
Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering, and proactively identify opportunities to improve our data infrastructure and processes.




Would be great if you brought this to the role:




Ownership of Customer Success data collection, storage, management, quality, and protection.
Extensive experience with data integration and ETL processes
Familiarity with data modeling, schema design, and data governance practices.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills within cross-functional teams.
Experience in governance, advising on, monitoring, and governing enterprise data.
Operations expertise in enabling data usability, availability, and efficiency.
Analytics support for reporting on products, customers, operations, and markets.
Growth mindset with a willingness to continuously learn and adapt to evolving technology.




Who we‚Äôre looking for:




5+ years of work experience in an enterprise engineering domain.
Excellent problem-solving skills and sharp attention to detail.
Solid written and verbal communication skills.
Enthusiasm for shipping high-quality code and helping peers do the same.
Relevant knowledge of cloud security and data security.
Understanding of web development practices and terminology.
Proactiveness and be self-driven to be successful working in a remote environment.
A belief in our mission and values.
Proficient in Python programming and well versed with popular frameworks like Pandas, Flask, Airflow, Apache Beam etc.
Experience interacting with APIs via code
Experience with any one cloud technologies i.e GCP, AWS or Azure.
Hands on experience with Cloud function, Big Query, DataFlow, Cloud Run, Airflow etc.
Experience building CI/CD pipelines.
Strong skills with writing SQL.




Bonus points:




Blockchain expertise.
Natural Language Processing experience.
You‚Äôre a MetaMask user!




Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We‚Äôre passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment‚Äîapply anyway, detailing your relevant transferable skills in your cover letter. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.

Job_description:
The role of a Community Engineer at Canonical




The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.




This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.




In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.




You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.




You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.




You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.




Location: This is a Globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.




What we are looking for in you




You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Come create the technology that helps the world act together




Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.




We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.




The team you'll be part of




As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.




Nokia Advanced Consulting Services is part of Nokia Cloud & Network Services Business Group and purpose or role will be in delivering consulting and analytics work packages for CEM Office, SOC Office and Real Time Data Science for Nokia customers in US.




What You Will Learn And Contribute To




Are you passionate about solving problems?




As part of our team, you will:




Promote solution adaption, usage innovation, timely project delivery, and revolutionary customer experience
Specialize in Telco deep analysis (RAN, CORE, voice, SIP, 5G, Fixed wireless, Fixed line.. etc.) from data feed to KPI to data model
Analyze large, complex, multi-dimensional data sets with a variety of analytic methods (math, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and software tools (e.g. scripting in Unix shell, SQL, Python, R, hive database, etc.)
Familiar with visualization tools (Tableau, Superset, Looker, PowerBI, and/or other similar tools)
Familiar with big data platform such as Hadoop
Perform ad-hoc analysis and perfect periodic dashboard reporting
Produce audience-appropriate readouts or presentation
Build, evaluate, and advance machine learning models, and interpret results and accuracy
Familiar with Anomaly detection and subscriber experience index




Your Skills And Experience




You have:




Bachelor¬¥s degree or equivalent experience required, candidates with Bachelor‚Äôs degree in economics, statistics, engineering, or computer science from a reputable institution
At least 10 years of experience in Telecommunication or mobile network
At least 8 years of experience in an external customer-facing position
Experience in data science field
Proven experience with advanced analytic methods, from mathematics, statistical modeling to machine learning methods
Ability to absorb broad ideas and break them down into meaningful minimum-value product deliveries
Coding skills in Python, R, SQL, Unix shell scripting
Familiar with database technologies and query languages
Good understanding of Mobile and Wireless Data Network architecture
Effective communication in English (written and verbal)

Job_description:
A U.S.-based company that is developing a shipping platform to assist e-commerce businesses in managing their shipping operations, is looking for a Business Intelligence Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be responsible for creating a compelling shipping experience for customers. The company's goal is to even out the playing field by giving businesses access to shipping tools and terms that they otherwise wouldn't have. The company has managed to secure more than $152mn during their Series E round of funding. This position requires 6+ hours of overlap with the PST time zone.




Job Responsibilities:




Build analytics systems to process and transform data
Connect to multiple shipping carriers around the world from one API and dashboard
Build a self-serve platform for internal stakeholders and external customers
Build analytics systems to process and transform data of massive scale into valuable operational and business insights for our internal and external customers
Build and maintain the business intelligence infrastructure and tools to present data with the most effective data visualization techniques and artifacts
Ensure that stakeholders are able to digest the insights from the analyzed datasets
Design, develop, scale, and evolve our self-service business intelligence solutions (e.g. Reports/Dashboards/Visualizations)
Utilize business intelligence technologies to convert business needs into effective visualizations, dashboards, and reports.
Improve the data models and data elements that business intelligence tools rely on by working together with data engineering and business teams
This will make data more accessible and encourage data-informed decision-making throughout the organization
Continuously identify opportunities and demands for better data management, quality, and delivery
Communicate and explain findings and suggestions at various levels with a definite bias toward effective learning and outcomes
Be a living example of the company's culture in your daily interactions and work
Promote the use of data to guide decisions




Job Requirements:




Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
Strong background in Data and Business Analysis
2+ years of experience working with BI or data engineering
Extensive experiences working with one or more BI platforms, such as Tableau and Looker
Working knowledge of data modeling (for example, dimensional modeling) and data analysis in a data warehouse
Comprehensive knowledge of SQL and the capacity to create and analyze complex SQL queries
Excellent knowledge of database management systems and the ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) framework Quick to pick up new skills and applications
Effective communication, presentation, and problem-solving abilities
Understanding of business processes, best practices, data lifecycles, and standard operating procedures
Thorough knowledge of customer requirements and a drive for client success
Display your commitment to excellence in craftsmanship, ongoing improvement, and team success
Experience working with implementing the ETL process is nice to have
Experience with Python and Looker Platform is desirable
Solid experience with Cloud Data Warehouses like AWS Redshift is preferred
Some knowledge of Source Control(git) and CI/CD pipelines is desirable
Nice to have some experience with advanced data analysis using Machine Learning
Possess problem-solving aptitude
Good English communication skills

About Us




We're an emerging U.S.- based company that provides custom application solutions to clients across the United States, and develops and maintains software platforms (web, mobile, and desktop) for client facing and internal tool portals. Our team of consultants work in collaboration with all resources of a software product's life cycle such as QA, developers, Project Managers, Designers, and other specialized roles. Our Proposal




We‚Äôre looking for an AWS Data Analyst, responsible for collecting, organizing, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can inform business decisions. The role involves working with data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, or external APIs, and applying statistical and analytical techniques to extract meaningful information.




Responsibilities




Gathering relevant data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, APIs, or external sources, ensuring its accuracy and completeness.
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, such as missing values, outliers, or inconsistencies. This involves data cleaning, standardization, normalization, and transformation to prepare it for analysis.

Presenting the findings of data analysis in a clear and understandable manner.
Interpreting the results of data analysis and providing actionable recommendations or insights based on the findings.
Ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data analysis results by validating them against known benchmarks, conducting sensitivity analysis, or comparing with external sources.
Working closely with business managers, executives, or other teams to understand their data needs, align analysis objectives with business goals, and communicate results effectively. Collaboration may also involve providing guidance on data-driven decision-making processes.
Staying updated with the latest data analysis techniques, tools, and industry best practices. Actively seeking opportunities to enhance data analysis processes, optimize data workflows, and drive efficiency in data-related tasks.
Adhering to data privacy regulations, ensuring data security, and maintaining ethical standards while handling sensitive or confidential information.
Applying critical thinking and problem-solving skills to tackle complex data challenges, identify root causes, and propose innovative solutions.

10 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Experienced in AWS.
Experience at building pipelines.
SCRUM.

Snowflake experience.

We're a software start-up, with growth opportunities.

Flexible schedules.

Info on the Senior BI Engineer role




Want to get to the next step in your international career? We can support you!




Ubiminds is a GPTW certified, people-first company that partners with American software product companies to scale their development footprint. Ubi custom-curates Brazilian top 5% talent for their LATAM strategy, offering a unique combo of staff augmentation and employer-of-record services.




Ubiminds is assisting KBRA, a global rating agency established to restore trust in credit ratings and offer accurate and transparent ratings.




Challenge




The Senior BI Engineer will be responsible for designing and implementing data models, dashboards, and visualizations to support business requirements.




Analyze user requirements, write SQL queries, and implement Power BI-enabled data & analytics solutions. And also, responsible for solving complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide actionable insights to decision-makers.




What you'll do




Work closely with stakeholders, translating business requirements into technical solutions
Create insightful and interactive dashboards and visualizations using Power BI
Analyze user requirements, write SQL queries, and implement Power BI-enabled data & analytics solutions
Ensure data availability and reliability for analysis and reporting by developing and maintaining SQL view statements
Design and implement efficient data models that support complex business scenarios and enable self-service reporting
Collaborate with other technology teams to integrate BI solutions with existing systems and applications





In order to succeed in this position, you will need:

Advanced/fluent English skills ‚Äì Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Power BI development experience: DAX formula language creating visual reports, paginated reports, and dashboards
Experience connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for business intelligence
Experience developing tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with data warehouse standards
Solid understanding of managing/rotating database connections in Power BI





gateway, and ability to grant/revoke access to reports in a granular way.

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work effectively independently, and collaborate with other teams
Eager to learn and constantly improve technical skills

People First. We are all about people!

Job_title: Mid-Senior Data Analyst - Remote - Latin America
Job_description:
FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

We‚Äôre most proud of:

Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world‚Äôs greatest companies.
Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.


The Position:

We're looking to hire one Data Analysts to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways:

Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.


What We're Looking For:

As a Data Engineer, you'll be working in a team responsible for Reports and Analytics for the highly loaded system and helping the team to achieve extraordinary results to impact the product and deliver the best solution to the market.
5+ years of experience in Data Analysis.
Meaningful experience with data visualization and ETL.
Meaningful experience with DBT.
Strong SQL experience is a must.
Meaningful experience with Snowflake.
Experience leading teams.
Experience with Looker and Tableau tools.
Advanced English is required.
A four-year college degree is required.
Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon.
Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them.
Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed.
A positive mindset and can-do attitude.
Forensic attention to detail.


Benefits:

Competitive pay in your local currency.
100% remote work.
The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
English Classes.
Virtual company events each month.
Ample opportunity for career advancement.
Continuing education opportunities.
Depending on your location other benefits may apply.


FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.

Job_description:
The role of a Community Engineer at Canonical




The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.




This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.




In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.




You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.




You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.




You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.




Location: This is a Globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.




What we are looking for in you




You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Position Summary:




HostPapa Inc. is one of the fastest-growing web technology companies. We help individuals and small-to-medium-sized businesses deliver their online dreams by hosting and supporting their websites, email, and cloud-based solutions. We aim to remain at the forefront of the web hosting industry by driving innovation and change, and by putting our customers first in everything that we do.




We are seeking an experienced Senior Systems Engineer to join our team. As theSenior Systems Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to ensure the stability, integrity, and efficient operation of the information systems that support our core organizational functions. This includes supervising the monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of the current fleet of internal servers and services, while actively participating in new optimization projects.




Reporting to the Systems Operations Manager under the Director of Infrastructure you will apply your communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify and resolve issues, plan and implement improvements, and communicate them, to maximize the benefit of IT systems.




What you‚Äôll do:




Implement an aligned infrastructure and technological stack and strategy focused on efficient operations across the organization
Measure the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems; develop and implement strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems
Monitor and test system performance; prepare and deliver system performance statistics and reports
Supervise and lead server operating system configuration and maintenance for a number of virtual servers, ensuring optimal performance and stability
Utilize industry-standard monitoring tools to identify and remediate security vulnerabilities on an on-going basis
Propose and create system design models and specifications to provide direction to development teams
Assist with defining business requirements, identify and resolve system issues, and contribute to the overall effectiveness of our business systems
Assist to all level engineers to ensure 24/7/365 availability of servers, systems and related infrastructure, whether for internal or customer facing systems
Create documentation related to all aspects of covered area to make it available and applicable for typical cases and keep it up-to-date
Collaborate with other departments to adequately keep track and report cross projects& tasks to ensure the best value and quality of an effort




About you:




Strong knowledge and experience with Linux (CentOS/RHEL/CloudLinux) and LAMP stack
Proficiency in Linux Firewall
Familiarity with Ubersmith (Galera, Docker Swarm, Nginx, PHP, and Solr)
Solid understanding of networking fundamentals (OSI model, protocols, routing, and firewalls)
Strong scripting knowledge in bash, Perl, and Python
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and drive projects to completion
Experience with MySQL/MariaDB/PostgreSQL, SQL administration is preferred
Being on call is an expected requirement for this position




Will be a plus:




Experience with virtualization platforms (Proxmox, Virtuozzo, and VMware)
Experience with configuration management systems (Ansible, Puppet, and Salt)
Familiarity with storage technologies like NFS and iSCSI troubleshooting




What we offer:




Work from anywhere - this is a remote opportunity
A competitive salary that values you and your unique skill sets
Career advancement& professional development opportunities to help you reach your full potential
Flexible work arrangements to support work/life balance




About us:




At HostPapa, we‚Äôve been committed to providing a complete array of enterprise-grade cloud services solutions to every business owner since 2006. These services, traditionally out of reach to smaller businesses, are offered in a one-stop shop, making it quick and easy for customers to select the services they need to grow. We back these offerings with 24/7 award-winning customer support in four languages.




Our HostPapa family values diversity and inclusion. We have a friendly company culture built on trust and respect spanning the entire company. With the acquisition of several companies into our product portfolio within the past year, we‚Äôre growing at an incredible rate and have ample opportunities for career growth.




Come join our talented team of enthusiastic, hard-working, passionate, driven people engaged in meaningful, innovative work. We can‚Äôt wait to meet you!




HostPapa is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of our diverse team.




HostPapa is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please let us know, and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process.

We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world‚Äôs greatest companies.
Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.


The Position:

We're looking to hire one Data Analysts to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways:

Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.


What We're Looking For:

As a Data Engineer, you'll be working in a team responsible for Reports and Analytics for the highly loaded system and helping the team to achieve extraordinary results to impact the product and deliver the best solution to the market.

Meaningful experience with DBT.

Forensic attention to detail.

Ample opportunity for career advancement.

Founded by Sameer Maskey Ph.D., Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, Fusemachines has a core mission of democratizing AI. 5+ years of real-world data engineering development experience in AWS (certifications preferred)
Strong programming Skills in one or more languages such as Python, Scala, and proficient in writing efficient and optimized code for data integration, storage, processing and manipulation.

Job_description:
The role of a Community Engineer at Canonical




The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.




This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.




In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.




You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.




You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.




You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.




Location: This is a Globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.




What we are looking for in you




You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

More about Pismo Jump into the waves of transformation Our story started in 2016, back on the California seaside, a place called Pismo beach.




The place was not only an inspiration to our name but also to how we see our contribution to the world.The smallest part of an ocean is a drop. Several drops together form waves. And waves are the energy of movement, of transformation. They represent the power of change in a fluid and organic way.




At Pismo, each of us are powerful drops embodying a huge wave of change in payments and banking .




Our core values




Responsibility & Commitment




Responsibility and Commitment are key tenets of Pismo's business. In all of our interactions, ethics and honesty serve as guiding principles. Transparency and alignment are essential at Pismo to foster a culture of accountability where people do not take shortcuts and dare to be vulnerable. We encourage ownership and enable our employees to be a part of the solution to our challenges.




Challenging the Status Quo to Drive Change




Pismo is a disruptive company that knows we can‚Äôt count on what got us here to get us where we want to go. Instead of following trends, our team members create them. We strive for the best solution for every situation, not the easiest. Taking the ordinary or common sense route is insufficient. This is how we affect real change.




Minimum Friction Experience




Pismo's success depends on fluid, clear, and careful internal and external communication. Our solutions should address issues directly rather than causing new ones. We understand that learning and development is a positive outcome of necessary friction. We want our customers and employees to have a pleasant experience free of bureaucracy.




Collective Power




Pismo isn't simply mine, yours, or some other team's. All of our people have a good purpose for being here. Each of us, in our way, has the freedom to be ourselves and know we are accepted. Pismo values being a multicultural organisation. We are stronger, more efficient, and happier when we operate as a team .




Delivering Value and Excellence




Constant development is essential as it allows us to supply high-quality products and services while ensuring that we always bring value to our clients. Pismo recognises the importance of new information in breaking down boundaries and forging new possibilities. We pave the way and set trends by developing market-leading solutions.




Focus on People




People are a company's most valuable asset. That is why we prioritise attracting and hiring the best people, followed by personal and professional development. We invest in people's growth and empower them to take charge of their careers. We value work-life balance because we understand how difficult it can be to distinguish between work and life.




--




Pismo is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Pismo does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. Pismo also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

Why join us

TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential. We're building software and hardware in one place‚Äîdisrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients.

Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals. We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders, helping to define the vision, product and user experience.

Product at TRACTIAN

The product organization develops infrastructure, databases, apps and services using IoT data. Our Developers and Engineers work together to make services and databases work as a core asset across the company. Our work is ingrained in Tractian‚Äôs decision-making process, in the efficiency of our operations and services, and in the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers.

What You'll Do

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for making machines more reliable by combining three key shifts in the industry: Analytics, Internet of Things and User Experience. The intersection of these trends allows Tractian to provide machines with a mechanical nervous system and the awareness to optimize their own health, thereby accelerating human productivity and safety.

Responsibilities

Be responsible for incremental improvements of our frontend and backend microservices that interact with our databases and customers

Create and improve new data ingestion, wrangling, storage tool, and services

Improve Python, JS/TS codes present in the main application today

Be part of a fast-growing data engineering team;

Architect, develop and operate our data architecture and frameworks

Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality code

Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve services quality

Work extensively with AWS and technology

Facilitate and drive collaboration with developers and stakeholders to seek exciting and results-oriented user-centric data problems

Conceptually familiar with AWS cloud resources (S3, VPC, EC2, RDS,...)

Experience using build, deployment and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes and Terraform

Job_description:
The role of a Community Engineer at Canonical




The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.




This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.




In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.




You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.




You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.




You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.




Location: This is a Globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.




What we are looking for in you




You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Job_description:
The role of a Community Engineer at Canonical




The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.




This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.




In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.




You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.




You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.




You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.




Location: This is a Globally remote role.

Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives

Job_description:
Job Description




Would you like to solve technical challenges for our customers?




Are you passionate about ensuring customer success?




Join our world class Technical Support team




Our Team strives to be the most trusted support services partner. We strive to keep our customers online businesses up and running. We utilize tools, process and knowledge to diagnose and resolve product, platform, and customer issues. We deliver media and security services to proactively maintain quality and protect our customer's online presence.




Make a difference to our business




As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will solve complex technical issues for our customers. Through proactively reviewing and mitigating risks you'll minimize potential disruptions for some of the top internet companies.




As a Cloud Support Engineer, you will be responsible for-




Collaborating with customers and internal cross-functional teams to identify, diagnose, resolve and report on technical issues
Contributing to the strategic direction of the global support team to develop and implement best practices
Partnering with internal Sales, Services, Engineering and Support teams to ensure customer success on the Akamai platform
Working with the customers manage customer incidents and escalations to closure
Communicating with customers in Japanese and internal communication in English (Written and Spoken)




Do What You Love




To be successful in this role you will-




Have experience with working on web application issues (HTML, javascript, JSP)
Be well versed in internet protocols such as HTTP(S), TCP/IP, DNS, SSL, network routing and troubleshooting
Be experienced in providing technical solutions and support to customers
Demonstrate ability to communicate professionally with customers and collaborate with internal stakeholders
Show passion for self improvement and education
Have fluency to communicate with customers and internal in fluent English and Spanish




Work in a way that works for you




FlexBase, Akamai's Global Flexible Working Program, is based on the principles that are helping us create the best workplace in the world. When our colleagues said that flexible working was important to them, we listened. We also know flexible working is important to many of the incredible people considering joining Akamai. FlexBase, gives 95% of employees the choice to work from their home, their office, or both (in the country advertised). This permanent workplace flexibility program is consistent and fair globally, to help us find incredible talent, virtually anywhere. We are happy to discuss working options for this role and encourage you to speak with your recruiter in more detail when you apply.




Learn what makes Akamai a great place to work




Connect with us on social and see what life at Akamai is like!




We power and protect life online, by solving the toughest challenges, together.




At Akamai, we're curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you'll thrive here.




Working for you




At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life-




Your health
Your finances
Your family
Your time at work
Your time pursuing other endeavors




Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.




About Us




Akamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build, deliver, and secure their digital experiences helping billions of people live, work, and play every day. With the world's most distributed compute platform from cloud to edge we make it easy for customers to develop and run applications, while we keep experiences closer to users and threats farther away.




Join us




Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!
