Job_description:
A U.S.-based company that aims to lower the cost of cancer treatment by diverting avoidable costs is looking for a Data Engineer. The engineer will be responsible for applying data management guidelines and standards. The company's noble goal is to make cancer patients and their caregivers' lives better during their treatment and remission journeys by offering a digital experience. The company has managed to securely raise $31mn+ during their Series A round of funding. This will be a part-time position.




Job Responsibilities:




Recognize and handle the data requirements of all business stakeholders
Take charge of developing fault-tolerant, scalable, and high-availability data applications for cloud platforms to store and handle terabytes of data from upstream sources
Create and maintain systems to anonymize data and match identities in the Jasper analytical environment
Collaborate on solution requirements with information architects, platform architects, data scientists, and product management
Address the data requirements by working with the quantitative teams
Create products that make it possible to quickly and accurately extract knowledge from all collected health, device, and behavior data
Create and manage procedures for ingesting, transforming, enhancing, and storing a mix of structured (healthcare data, EHR, PROs, devices, etc.) and unstructured (notes, radiology images, etc.) data while ensuring data availability and quality
Adapt and convey difficult material, persuading and acting with prompt/actionable follow-up
Participate in the creation, implementation, and testing of products
Improve the process by making suggestions for data gathering, data consumption, and data storage improvements
By thoroughly analyzing intricate business processes, system processes, organizational standards, and procedures, you may resolve high impact issues and initiatives
Use BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Data Catalog, DataFlow, and GCP to oversee development, testing, and production implementation
Ensure that the databases and file systems upstream and downstream of the data warehouse are maintained
Ensure adequate data solutions to accomplish goals and identify and specify essential system and process improvements by working with multiple teams.
Perform personnel tasks for direct reports (such as recruiting, performance reviews, or mentoring)
Oversee agile data engineering teams to meet sprint and program increment goals
Participate in business partner engagement, relationship management, and cross-group planning among peers and technology leadership




Job Requirements:




Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4+ years of relevant experience as a data engineer or other relevant roles
Prior expertise as a Technical Lead for Data Warehouse, BI, and ETL
Extensive knowledge of analytics ideas including data warehousing, data lake, and ETL technologies
Comprehensive understanding of several mission-critical apps running on big data platforms
Ability to operate in a fast-paced workplace with geographically dispersed teams Demonstrable familiarity with batch and real-time data pipelines in a DevOps setting Agile teams operating in various shifts
Track record of success in creating an analytical environment and the related tools
Ability to build and maintain excellent collaborative connections with business stakeholders at all levels
Prior employment in the healthcare industry
Extensive experience creating environments for or working with data-driven statistical models
Experience dealing with payer claims data and provider EHR data
Exceptional expertise in working with sensitive data in a highly regulated environment
Proven track record putting difficult and creative ideas into action
Papers and articles in the area of data engineering
Be the team captain, set an example, inspire, and encourage cooperation among teammates
Fluent in conversational and written English communication

Job_title: Senior Data Engineer - DSP for Energy Analysis
Job_description:
Why join us




TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential. We're building software and hardware in one place‚Äîdisrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients.




Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals. We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders, helping to define the vision, product and user experience.




Data at TRACTIAN




The Data team develops infrastructure, statistical models, and products using IoT data. Our Scientists and Engineers work together to make data‚Äîand insights derived from data‚Äîa core asset across the company. Our work is ingrained in Tractian‚Äôs decision-making process, in the efficiency of our operations and insights, and in the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers.




What You'll Do




We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Engineer with expertise in Digital Signal Processing (DSP) for Energy Analysis Sensors to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure for processing and analyzing energy data obtained from sensors using DSP techniques. The candidate should also have experience with software development, data modeling, and data warehousing.




Responsibilities




Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and infrastructure for processing and analyzing data obtained from sensors using DSP techniques.




Develop and implement DSP algorithms for processing and analyzing data, including filtering, transformation, feature extraction, and classification.




Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and develop solutions to complex data problems.




Design and implement data models and schemas for storing and retrieving data and associated metadata in data warehouses and data lakes.




Ensure data quality and consistency across various data sources and platforms.




Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and trends in DSP, Analysis, data engineering, and data science.




Requirements




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.




5+ years of experience in data engineering, with a focus on Digital Signal Processing for Analysis Sensors.




Strong knowledge of DSP fundamentals, including filtering, transformation, feature extraction, and classification.




Experience with software development in languages such as , Go or C++.




Experience with data modeling and schema design for data warehousing and data lakes, using tools such as and.




Bonus Points




Experience with data storage solutions and, working with different databases (AWS S3, Scylla, MongoDB and others)




Knowledge designing event-driven applications (like Kafka)




Fluent English proficiency




Compensation




Competitive salary and stock options




R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets, restaurants and delivery




GymPass so you don't sit/work all day




Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses




30 days of paid annual leave




Education and courses stipend




Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years




Day off during the week of your birthday




R$200 a month for remote work allowance




Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy




Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation




Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.




Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities




Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps

Job_description:
About Fusemachines




Fusemachines is an artificial intelligence talent and education solutions company dedicated to democratizing AI. Headquartered in New York, US with operations in Dominican Republic, Canada, and Nepal, it is a 350+ company. Fusemachines' AI educational program has made world-class AI education available, accessible and affordable to students around the world. Fusemachines helps organizations identify opportunities where AI can be best utilized to transform and grow their business.




About The Role




We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior NLP Engineer with a strong background in Language Model-based Machine Learning (LLM) to join our team. The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience in training LLMs and developing NLP models, with a particular focus on models such as GPT-3, Bloom, and BERT.




This is a remote, full time consulting position.




Responsibilities




Design and develop state-of-the-art NLP models and systems utilizing LLM techniques.
Train and fine-tune LLMs to achieve optimal performance in various NLP tasks, such as text generation, sentiment analysis, and named entity recognition.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to understand business requirements and develop NLP solutions.
Conduct research and stay updated with the latest advancements in the field of NLP and LLMs, and apply relevant techniques to enhance our existing models.
Optimize NLP models for performance, scalability, and efficiency to handle large-scale datasets. Implement and maintain deployment pipelines for NLP models in a cloud environment, particularly AWS.
Ensure the security and privacy of data throughout the development and deployment processes.
Mentor and provide guidance to junior NLP engineers, assisting them in their professional growth.




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
A Ph.D. is a plus. years of industry experience in NLP engineering, with a focus on LLMs.
5+ years of industry experience
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in training and fine-tuning LLMs, particularly models like GPT-3, Bloom, and BERT.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with experience in NLP libraries/frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face. Experience with cloud platforms, specifically AWS, and deploying NLP models in a cloud environment.
Solid understanding of NLP concepts, techniques, and algorithms, such as word embeddings, attention mechanisms, and sequence labeling.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in leading and mentoring a team of NLP engineers is a plus.

Job_description:
Are you a young software developer, enthusiastic and eager to build and ship amazing products? Do you have high standards for code quality and user experiences? Do you feel you could be the best developer on your team? Are you ready to work alongside the best engineers in the world for name-brand, industry-leading companies?




Bluelight Consulting is seeking a Junior Frontend developer to join its growing team.




As a developer at Bluelight Consulting, you will help our incredible clients achieve their technical goals in one of two ways: 1) Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client‚Äôs team and work alongside their existing engineers on a daily basis. 2) Design & Build: You will work on a Bluelight Consulting development team to build and ship greenfield applications for our clients.

Proficiency in HTML and JavaScript with a focus on landing page development

Health Coverage
Flexible working hours
Work remotely
Continuing education, training, conferences
Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications

The company has successfully managed to secure more than $1.7bn in funding so far. This position requires 8+ hours of overlap with the EST time zone and can lead to full-time opportunities.

Combine technical capabilities with business knowledge and communication abilities

To guarantee that business requirements and ETL logic are compatible, identify data discrepancies, and maintain clear, up-to-date code

Job_description:
Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.




We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.




If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.




The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at Canonical




Support analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.




In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.




Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region. All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job opening.




What your day will look like




Utilise advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisation
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Tell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualisations and presentations
Design and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote work
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace




What we are looking for in you




An exceptional academic track record with a BA/BSc or Masters degree in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
First work experience in People Analytics
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




üè† Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!




üìö Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum




üí∞ Annual compensation review




üèÜ Recognition rewards




üèù Annual holiday leave




üë∂ Parental Leave




üßë‚Äçüíº Employee Assistance Programme




üß≥ Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'




‚úàÔ∏è Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
